{"step_by_step_thinking": "The p-value is used to determine whether the null hypothesis should be rejected or retained. If the p-value is less than the pre-specified significance level (usually 0.05), the null hypothesis is rejected. Therefore, the correct interpretation is to reject Ho (null hypothesis) when p < 0.05. Hence, the answer is A. Rejective Ho, p < 0.05.", "answer_choice": "A"}
